title: High Gender Equality Rating
description: In 2023, Uzbekistan achieved a CPIA gender equality rating of 4.5, reflecting a strong commitment to gender equality compared to global standards.

title: Efficient Revenue Mobilization
description: Uzbekistan scored 4.5 in the CPIA efficiency of revenue mobilization rating in 2023, indicating effective strategies in collecting government revenue.

title: High Educational Attainment for Adults
description: By 2022, 99.98% of Uzbekistan's population aged 25+ had completed at least lower secondary education, showcasing a highly educated adult population.

title: Minimal Primary School Repeaters
description: In 2018, the percentage of repeaters in primary education was extremely low, with only 0.00125% of students repeating a grade.

title: Low Private Secondary School Enrollment
description: As of 2022, only 0.31% of secondary school students in Uzbekistan were enrolled in private institutions, indicating a strong public education system.

title: High Compensation of Employees
description: In 2023, the compensation of employees in Uzbekistan reached 60.2 trillion LCU, highlighting significant investment in human resources.

title: Significant Net Borrowing
description: Uzbekistan's net borrowing in 2023 was -51.5 trillion LCU, indicating a reliance on external financial resources.

title: High Other Expenses
description: In 2023, Uzbekistan's other expenses amounted to 61.3 trillion LCU, reflecting substantial non-specific expenditures.

title: Substantial Import Duties
description: Customs and other import duties in Uzbekistan were valued at 11.1 trillion LCU in 2023, indicating a significant revenue source from international trade.

title: High Taxes on International Trade
description: In 2023, Uzbekistan collected 11.1 trillion LCU in taxes on international trade, underscoring the importance of trade taxes in the national budget.

title: Limited Labor Force with Basic Education
description: In 2020, only 12.6% of Uzbekistan's working-age population had basic education, suggesting a need for improved educational access.
